tags: a song of ice and fire
daily reminder that dany only started to have control of her life at 16-17 years old in the show and 14-15 in the books
daily reminder that brienne only started doing what she wanted in her late teenagehood
cersei only started having control as a full grown adult
even in these situations there are still a lot of people waiting to put them in certain roles
summary: For starters, Sansa didn’t have a lot of control on her life and destiny at the beginning of the story not because she was...
body: For starters, Sansa didn’t have a lot of control on her life and destiny at the beginning of the story not because she was stupid or weak (she definitely wasn’t and still isn’t any of these two things), it’s a result of institutionalized and systematic sexism that puts women in these kinds of roles where they don’t get to have a say in their fate. It’s scary that so many people don’t get that and instead, they blame and hate on this preteen girl for not having any control on her future.

reblog.comment: For starters, Sansa didn’t have a lot of control on her life and destiny at the beginning of the story not because she was stupid or weak (she definitely wasn’t and still isn’t any of these two things), it’s a result of institutionalized and systematic sexism that puts women in these kinds of roles where they don’t get to have a say in their fate. It’s scary that so many people don’t get that and instead, they blame and hate on this preteen girl for not having any control on her future.

It’s scary that so many people don’t get that and instead, they blame and hate on this preteen girl for not having any control on her future.
trail.content: For starters, Sansa didn’t have a lot of control on her life and destiny at the beginning of the story not because she was stupid or weak (she definitely wasn’t and still isn’t any of these two things), it’s a result of institutionalized and systematic sexism that puts women in these kinds of roles where they don’t get to have a say in their fate. It’s scary that so many people don’t get that and instead, they blame and hate on this preteen girl for not having any control on her future.

summary: Do you think Elia’s personality was like Sansa’s? I think the comparison is a good fit.
question: Do you think Elia’s personality was like Sansa’s? I think the comparison is a good fit.
answer: I do from the description we got but then again I doubt Barristan knew her well so might have been a persona Elia put on to make sure people don’t associate her with Dornish stereotypes. I do think they are similar including the perfect prince who wasn’t so perfect and a civil war caused by that prince that in Elia’s case caused her death.

I do think they are similar including the perfect prince who wasn’t so perfect and a civil war caused by that prince that in Elia’s case caused her death.

summary: EVERYTHING WE KNOW ABOUT THE FINAL SEASON OF GAME OF THRONES
title: EVERYTHING WE KNOW ABOUT THE FINAL SEASON OF GAME OF THRONES
body:
Here’s everything we know about the final season of Game of Thrones!

The season will consist of 6 episodes only, and each one will be feature-length (at least 60 minutes each). The season will premiere during the first half of 2019, most probably in April but no official release date yet.

David Nutter (directed of the Red Wedding) will direct 3 episodes this season, including the premiere. Miguel Sapochnik (Battle of the B*stards) will direct 2 episodes, & the show’s creators,  David Benioff & D.B. Weiss will direct the very last episode.

The battle scenes will be more epic (as expected). One feature-length episode is set to focus entirely on a MAJOR battle which took 55 days to film. Peter Dinklage, who plays Tyion, has said this season makes the BotB “look like a theme park”.

Sophie Turner has said the finale is “bloodier than ever. It’s full of betrayal, full of war, full of danger”.

Sophie Turner described the ending as “satisfying”, while Peter Dinklage said the showrunners ”end it brilliantly. Better than I could have imagined, and you people are in for it. It ends beautifully for my character – whether it be tragic or not.”

There’s a new character! Harry Strickland, played by Marc Rissmann, is the leader of the Golden Company, the group of mercenaries that Cersei hires with Euron Greyjoy. There are other new characters but we know nothing about them.

*MILD SPOILERS AHEAD FOR SEASON 8*

- Ghost (Jon’s direwolf) is back

- The season is going to open with Daenerys’ tense arrival in Winterfell meeting the Starks, it is described as being similar to Robert’s arrival in season 1

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: Touch
body:
Written for @jonsadrabbles Day 2: Essos OR Touch

Jon and Sansa spend their evening looking at the stars, talking and touching.

Modern AU, college AU, stargazing AU

There was something magical about the dark. Maybe it was the absolute silence, because most people were asleep. Maybe it was the promise of nice dreams of anything that could and couldn’t happen. Or maybe it was because it was when Jon and Sansa had the most deep conversations about whatever their hearts desired and longed for.

Jon stared at the million stars above his head. He had read somewhere that looking at the stars was looking at the past, at something that has been, but probably wasn’t anymore. He had to admit that it wasn’t a very romantic explanation. But he had never been very romantic anyway. Not until he had met her at least.

“A penny for your thoughts.” Sansa turned towards him. She folded her hands under her head and a smile spread across her angelic face. And all those million stars and reflections of the past glimmered in her eyes.

Jon cleared his throat. “You don’t wanna know.” He faced her and pulled one leg up to make himself a little more comfortable. “It was something scientific and boring.”

A soft chuckle escaped Sansa’s lips and she wiped a few dark black curls from his face. “My little professor.” She whispered, but instead of pulling her hand back she touched his cheek and his neck.

A shiver rolled down his spine and he curled his fingers around her wrist. “My little angel.” He closed his eyes and couldn’t help but think that there had never been a better and more beautiful moment than this. “What and who would I be without you?”

Lost. Stuck in study books, Locked up in libraries because he forgot the time. Overworked and exhausted too, probably.

“Did you know that Plato stated that every human was born with four feet and four arms?” Sansa moved a little closer towards him and she placed her head on his chest. “They became so powerful that the Gods were forced to destroy them. They split them up in two parts, and since that day we alway longs for our other half.”

Jon curled his lips up into a smile and he pressed a soft kiss on her forehead. “Technically Aristophanos presented that story. Plato wrote it down, but still.”

Sansa pushed herself up and shook her head. “One day, Jon Snow.” She tapped the tip of his nose. “One day I’ll be able to tell you something you don’t know yet.”

“There is a lot I don’t know yet.” Jon let the tips of his fingers wander over her back. “But I guess most things need to be shown and not told.”

“I will show you everything.” Sansa sat up again and straddled him. “Everything you already know, everything you know you don’t know and everything you don’t know you don’t know.”

Jon smiled. “I always thought Aristophanos was wrong.” Jon stretched out his hand and touched her face. “But maybe he wasn’t.”

tags: like someone said grrm seems to think flaws in women are more unforgivable than those in men
summary: Unpopular opinion I think Jon is more classiest than cat or sansa.  Didn't he switch out Gilly's son for Mance's son and take a...
question: Unpopular opinion I think Jon is more classiest than cat or sansa.  Didn't he switch out Gilly's son for Mance's son and take a child from her mother because apparently Mance's son is more important than Gilly's son.  How is it that Jon and/or dany are so good with smallfolk relations and are feminists when they BOTH treat people who are lower in status badly.
answer: He also bullied the Night’s Watch recruits because he thought they were beneath him. Jon and Dany are both lucky that they are made of tropes beloved by fantasy readers (Dany was poor unlike Jon so she gets some leeway from me). Characters like Sansa and Catelyn don’t invite sympathy easily, people expect the worst of them. But it is important to mention that this issue comes from GRRM himself. He decided that Jon’s classism should be a problem for a short while before Jon gets talked out of it and whatever discriminatory acts Jon does after that don’t get called out by the text as classist. On the other hand GRRM seems to think it’s an issue that Sansa (and Bran though Bran’s classism seems like it’s mostly ableism) should work through.

summary: Wrote a big Arya and Sansa conversation for a fanfic and remembered how salty I am that D&D decided to pit them against each...
body: Wrote a big Arya and Sansa conversation for a fanfic and remembered how salty I am that D&D decided to pit them against each other for cheap drama after all they’ve been through. And yeah, even if you choose to read it as “they were pretending the whole time” we know that’s not what D&D intended cause of that stupid deleted scene. Anyway, Arya and Sansa better be ride-or-die in the last season.

reblog.comment: Wrote a big Arya and Sansa conversation for a fanfic and remembered how salty I am that D&D decided to pit them against each other for cheap drama after all they’ve been through. And yeah, even if you choose to read it as “they were pretending the whole time” we know that’s not what D&D intended cause of that stupid deleted scene. Anyway, Arya and Sansa better be ride-or-die in the last season.

trail.content_raw: Wrote a big Arya and Sansa conversation for a fanfic and remembered how salty I am that D&D decided to pit them against each other for cheap drama after all they’ve been through. And yeah, even if you choose to read it as “they were pretending the whole time” we know that’s not what D&D intended cause of that stupid deleted scene. Anyway, Arya and Sansa better be ride-or-die in the last season.
trail.content: Wrote a big Arya and Sansa conversation for a fanfic and remembered how salty I am that D&D decided to pit them against each other for cheap drama after all they’ve been through. And yeah, even if you choose to read it as “they were pretending the whole time” we know that’s not what D&D intended cause of that stupid deleted scene. Anyway, Arya and Sansa better be ride-or-die in the last season.

summary: Lol. People seriously believe Sansa is going to braid Dany’s hair? Well, that would explain Emilia’s short hair: Catelyn Stark...
body:
Lol. People seriously believe Sansa is going to braid Dany’s hair?

Well, that would explain Emilia’s short hair: Catelyn Stark came back from the dead and cut them off (long live Lady Stoneheart :p )! Sansa is the Lady of Winterfell and the heiress of a prestigious house. NO WAY IN THE SEVEN HELLS will she become Daenerys’ chamber maid! Dany has Missandei for that, that’s quite enough, thank you!

This is GOT, guys, not a CW TV show!

summary: Missy's Experiment: Is Earth A Planet of Sex Hounds?
title: Missy's Experiment: Is Earth A Planet of Sex Hounds?
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2qUN2aD

by Title_Of_Your_Sex_Tape

Missy has created a facility to gather all sorts of humans at random for an experiment. The experiment is designed to prove that Missy’s theory that humans are the most sex crazed species in the universe is true. The Doctor, despite her concerns, decides to take part.

Words: 1023, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Doctor Who (2005), Marvel Cinematic Universe, Game of Thrones (TV), Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. (TV)

blog.description:
iss your ~problematic~ fave |  JON SNOW | CLERITH | CLOUD STRIFE | 
 JONERYS | 
MATT MURDOCK | SPACE |  karedevil | kastle | mattelektra | ben poindexter | RICK GRIMES | richonne | CARYL | ichiruki | sasusaku | GAME OF THRONES | aliens | synthwave | the walking dead (1-6) ♥

summary:
fortunatelylori
 replied to your post  “i legit cant wait for sansa to braid dany’s wedding hair”
                       ...
body:
fortunatelylori replied to your post

“i legit cant wait for sansa to braid dany’s wedding hair”

“normal female bonding?!?” - I think someone might have seen one too many romcoms … Believe it or not, when one woman sees another woman, our first instinct is not “hey, let’s braid her hair!” That why “braiding each other’s hair” is essentially a joke now on how superficial society at large views relationships between women. But sure, Sansa will see a sliver haired wig and think “BRAIDS!”. there is absolutely no way things will go differently.

im a woman. you can spare me that whole “patriarchy!!111″ shit. 

second of all. this is sansa stark. 

just because ramsay bolton raped her doesn’t mean her entire character is “ruined” or changed. women aren’t defined by their rape. 

she still has maintained the sweetness that she had as a late teenager. proof? 

  • sansa was still fangirling about marrying loras tyrell a little over a year before being married off to ramsay. 
  • she was also giddy about finally having a “girly” sister with margaery that she never had with arya. 
  • when reunited with her older brother, she immediately took to sewing a stark cloak for jon

dont fucking tell me that sweet side of sansa is dead because some guy raped her. it’s still there. she just knows when to let that girly fun side come out.

so again. 

I CANT FUCKING WAIT TO SEE SANSA BRAID HER SISTER IN LAWS WEDDING HAIR

blog.name: princessaryathevaliant
blog.title: Princess Arya the Valiant
blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

summary: Arya most likely wouldn’t have survived in Sansa’s place. Sansa most likely wouldn’t have survived in Arya’s place. They are...
question: Arya most likely wouldn’t have survived in Sansa’s place. Sansa most likely wouldn’t have survived in Arya’s place. They are immediately painted as polar opposite characters to each other that have little in common yet people still compare them?? And expect one to behave like the other?? Like ??? How??? They’re so different!
answer: I wouldn’t say that they wont be able to. Despite their differences, one thing that Arya and Sansa have in common is that they are survivors. They are adaptable, they are capable of changing themselves in amazing ways to accommodate themselves in different situations. They do have different skill sets in some aspects that are best utilised in the canon plots, but there is nothing to say they wont have been able to survive (make it through in the end alive) if their situations had been exchanged. Yes, initially they would have struggled. Arya is more familiar with  commoners and had an easier time in adjusting to the environmental ( & social?) change than Sansa would have. And Arya is not as good with her words as Sansa is. But the whole idea is that the struggles and journeys both characters go through are learning experiences (horrifically traumatic ones) as well, and both sisters are quick learners and despite struggles, i definitely believe both would have made it through in the end.

But the whole idea is that the struggles and journeys both characters go through are learning experiences (horrifically traumatic ones) as well, and both sisters are quick learners and despite struggles, i definitely believe both would have made it through in the end.
